intro: Nicotiana suaveolens var. macrantha, commonly known as the sweet tobacco or showy tobacco, is a herbaceous plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in moist, open habitats. The flowers bloom in summer and are known for their strong, sweet fragrance.
